channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stocks jump at end of roller-coaster week while de-dollarization trade continues to slam the greenback and U.S. bonds
item.description: Elsewhere in financial markets, the mood was gloomier and pointed to deteriorating confidence in U.S. assets.

item.title: GM reveals the real reason its halting Canadian production and laying off workers—and it’s not Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Canada's subsidiary of General Motors is temporarily halting production and cutting staff at an assembly plant in Ingersoll, Ontario.

item.title: Trump tariffs backfire on Elon Musk, as Tesla pulls U.S.-built models from China
item.description: Tesla has stopped taking orders for the Model S and Model X in China, which now face retaliatory 125% import duties levied by Beijing.

item.title: 12 former OpenAI employees asked to be heard in Elon Musk’s lawsuit against the company; one calls Sam Altman a ‘person of low integrity’
item.description: In a friend of the court filing by Harvard law professor Lawrence Lessig, a dozen former employees accuse OpenAI of abandoning its nonprofit roots and...

item.title: The helicopter company in the deadly NYC crash that killed an executive and his whole family recently emerged from bankruptcy and already faces a $1.4 million lawsuit
item.description: New York Helicopter had difficulties before one of its sightseeing choppers plummeted into the Hudson River, killing all six people aboard.

item.title: Can a president break insider-trading laws? Trump’s online post ignites debate.
Here are this week’s 20 best performers as the S&P 500 rallied
Treasury yields are surging despite stock-market chaos. Investors are worried.
U.S. stocks end sharply higher to cap tumultuous week on Wall Street
Collapse of the dollar shows ‘the biggest damage right now is to the U.S. brand’
